briefdescription.para: Screen edges used for edge scrolling.
The action manager to used for keybind action lookups.
The global context.
Maps actions to events.
Stack of active input contexts.

detaileddescription.para: The most recent entry is pushed on top of the stack.

briefdescription.para: key to is_down map.

detaileddescription.para: stores a mapping between keycodes and its pressing state. a true value means the key is currently pressed, false indicates the key is untouched.

briefdescription.para: Current key modifiers.

detaileddescription.para: Included ALL modifiers including num lock and caps lock.

briefdescription.para: mode where mouse position is ignored used for map scrolling
mouse position in the window
mouse position relative to the last frame position.
Return the string representation of the bind assignated to an action.
Set the given action to be triggered by the given bind (key/mouse /wheel).

detaileddescription.para: Remove previous assignation. Do nothing if either they given bind or action is invalid/unknow.

briefdescription.para: Return the string representation of the key event.
Return the string representation of the mouse event.
Return the key representation of the event.
returns the global keybind context.

detaileddescription.para: actions bound here will be retained even when override_context is called.

briefdescription.para: Returns the context on top.

detaileddescription.para: Note there is always a top context since the global context will be considered on top when none are registered

briefdescription.para: register a hotkey context by pushing it onto the stack.

detaileddescription.para: this adds the given pointer to the contexts list. that way the context lays on "top".
if other contexts are registered afterwards, it wanders down the stack, i.e. looses priority.

briefdescription.para: removes any matching registered context from the stack.

detaileddescription.para: the removal is done by finding the given pointer in the contexts lists, then deleting it in there.

briefdescription.para: true if the given event type is being ignored
manages the pressing of an input event (key, mouse, ...).

detaileddescription.para: first checks whether an action is bound to it. if it is, look for an handler to execute that handler. returns true if the event was responded to

briefdescription.para: sets the state of a specific key
updates mouse position state and motion
updates mouse motion only
enable relative mouse mode
Query whether cursor is at edgo of screen.

simplesect.para: true when the mouse is at the queried screen edge, false else.

briefdescription.para: Query stored pressing stat for a key.

detaileddescription.para:
note that the function stores a unknown/new keycode as 'not pressed' if requested
true when the key is pressed, false else.

briefdescription.para: Most cases should use above is_down(class, code) instead to avoid relying on sdl types.

detaileddescription.para:
Query stored pressing stat for a key.
true when the key is pressed, false else.

briefdescription.para: Checks whether a key modifier is held down.
When a SDL event happens, this is called.
Return a string representation of active key bindings from the given context.
Get the action manager attached to this input manager.
The input manager manages all input layers (hud, game, ...) and triggers the registered actions depending on the active layer.

detaileddescription.para: cppclass InputManager: bool set_bind(char* bind_char, string action) except + string get_bind(string action) except +
